value: **  PROJECT:  "Ideology, Learning, and Policy Diffusion: Experimental
**  Evidence", American Journal of Political Science
**  AUTHORS: Daniel M. Butler, Craig Volden, Adam M. Dynes, and Boris
**  DESCRIPTION: Stata code (Do File) to replicate figures and tables
**  in the paper and the appendices

** In the public version of the replication files, we we do not provide the information on the demographics from the cities in the sample in order to protect the  confidentiality of respondents. Lines of code that cannot be completed using the public replication files are commented out with the // tag.

** Additional Stata Packages Needed to Produce Tables: (Unless noted otherwise, the packages can be found in Stata by typing the following into Stata's command line "ssc install" followed by the command name or "findit" followed by the command name.)
** Installing the estout package will allow users to run the esttab, estsimp, and estpost commands used in the analysis.
** To get the necessary packages type in the following in Stata's command line:
** Note: The second file is an exectuable file that can only be run using a DOS/Windows machine.

** Note: If these commands do not work, you may need to manually download the gam command by going to http://fmwww.bc.edu/repec/bocode/g/ and clicking on gam.pkg and gam.zip. Then copy gam.pkg and extract the contents of gam.zip into the ado directory (C:\ado\plus\g).
/*This seed is set for the purpose of replicating the clarify results exactly each time*/
// these are respondents from the 2012 AMOS who did not participate in Study #1
** Save those in sample for Figure 1
//logit diffussion_interest score interaction success redevelop_con democrat republican election_partisan log_pop perc_black perc_latino perc_college unemp_rate perc_mortgage perc_second_mortgage
//outreg2 using table1, dec(2) 2aster word se ctitle("") label append
** Table C1: Summary Statistics for Variables in Table 1

//estpost summarize diffussion_interest score interaction success redevelop_con democrat republican election_partisan log_pop perc_black perc_latino perc_college unemp_rate perc_mortgage perc_second_mortgage if e(sample)==1
//esttab using tableC1, cells("mean sd min max") nomtitle nonumber noobs rtf replace
** clarify to get the predicted results for specific examples used in the text

//estsimp logit diffussion_interest score interaction success redevelop_con democrat republican election_partisan log_pop perc_black perc_latino perc_college unemp_rate perc_mortgage perc_second_mortgage

** Figure 2: Diminished Interest in Learning among Conservative Policymakers

** Figure D1: Figure 3 Showing Republicans Only
** Regression of results shown in Figure D1
//logit diffussion_interest score interaction success redevelop_con  election_partisan log_pop perc_black perc_latino perc_college unemp_rate perc_mortgage perc_second_mortgage if republican==1
** Figure S3: Figure D1 with 95% Confidence Intervals
** Table S1: Interest in Learning by Timing of Response

**NOTE: the coefficient on rd_3 provides the estimate of the Difference and its Standard Error as reported in Table S1. The Constant provides the proportion of Early Respondents who were interested in learning, while the combination of the Constant and the coefficient on rd_3 provide the proportion of Late Respondents who were interested.
// quietly run regression from model 2 of Table 1 so that Table S1 examines the same sample
** Table S2: Effect by Timing of Survey Response (Model S2.1, Experiment #1)

//logit diffussion_interest rd_3 score success rd3_score rd3_success interaction rd3_interaction redevelop_con democrat republican election_partisan log_pop perc_black perc_latino perc_college unemp_rate perc_mortgage perc_second_mortgage
//outreg2 using tableS2, dec(2) 2aster word se ctitle("S2.1") label replace
** Table S3. Generalized Additive Models, Smoothing Ideology Variables (Model S3.1, Experiment #1)
** NOTE: The outreg2 command does not produce tables for regressions produced by the gam command. Thus, Table S3 was created from the tables produced directly in Stata' Results Windows.

//gam diffussion_interest score interaction success redevelop_con democrat republican election_partisan log_pop perc_black perc_latino perc_college unemp_rate perc_mortgage perc_second_mortgage, family(binomial) link(logit) df(score interaction: 3)
// these are respondents from the 2012 AMOS who did not participate in Study #2
** Generate place fillers for variables not in Study 2 so that their labels are correct in the exported table
** Table 2: Ideological Extremism and Partisan Learning
** Save those in sample for Figure 1
//logit diffussion_interest matched_party extremity interactionext foreclosure democrat election_partisan log_pop perc_black perc_latino perc_college unemp_rate perc_mortgage perc_second_mortgag

//outreg2 using table2, dec(2) 2aster word se ctitle(Interest) sortvar(score matched_party ideal_party extremity interactionext matched_party foreclosure democrat election_partisan log_pop perc_black perc_latino perc_college unemp_rate perc_mortgage perc_second_mortgag) label append

** Table S1: Interest in Learning by Timing of Response

**NOTE: the coefficient on rd_3 provides the estimate of the Difference and its Standard Error as reported in Table S1. The Constant provides the proportion of Early Respondents who were interested in learning, while the combination of the Constant and the coefficient on rd_3 provide the proportion of Late Respondents who were interested.
// quietly run regression from model 6 of Table 2 so that Table S1 examines the same sample
** Table S2: Effect by Timing of Survey Response (Model S2.2, Experiment #2)

//logit diffussion_interest rd_3 extremity matched_party rd3_extremity rd3_match interactionext rd3_interactionext foreclosure democrat election_partisan log_pop perc_black perc_latino perc_college unemp_rate perc_mortgage perc_second_mortgag

//outreg2 using tableS2, dec(2) 2aster word se ctitle("S2.2") sortvar(rd_3 score success rd3_score rd3_success interaction rd3_interaction extremity matched_party rd3_extremity rd3_match interactionext rd3_interactionext foreclosure democrat election_partisan log_pop perc_black perc_latino perc_college unemp_rate perc_mortgage perc_second_mortgag) label append
** Table S3. Generalized Additive Models, Smoothing Ideology Variables (Model S3.2, Experiment #2)
** NOTE: The outreg2 command does not produce tables for regressions produced by the gam command. Thus, Table S3 was created from the tables produced directly in Stata' Results Windows.

//gam diffussion_interest extremity interactionext matched_party foreclosure democrat election_partisan log_pop perc_black perc_latino perc_college unemp_rate perc_mortgage perc_second_mortgag, family(binomial) link(logit) df(extremity interactionext: 3)
"Do you support eliminating public funding for abortions and public funding of organizations that advocate or perform abortions?"
"Do you support federal funding to create lines of stem cells from new embryos?"
"Do you support prohibiting the late-term abortion procedure known as partial-birth abortion?"
"Do you support including sexual orientation in your state's anti-discrimination laws?"
"Do you support requiring that crimes based on sexual orientation be prosecuted as federal hate crimes?"
"Should your state recognize civil unions between same-sex couples?"
"Do you support affirmative action in state college and university admissions?"
"Should the federal government consider race and gender in government contracting decisions?"
"Do you support opening a select portion of the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge for oil exploration?"
"Do you support requiring the federal government to reimburse citizens when environmental regulations limit use of privately owned lands?"
"Do you support the U.S. re-entering the Kyoto treaty process to limit global warming?"
"Should state environmental regulations be stricter than federal law?"
"Do you favor allowing citizens to carry concealed firearms?"
"Do you support banning the sale or transfer of all forms of semi-automatic weapons?"
"Do you support increasing restrictions on the purchase and possession of firearms?"
"Do you support amnesty for certain illegal immigrants who already reside in the U.S.?"
"Do you support establishing English as the official and recognized language of the U.S.?"
"Do you support prohibiting states from passing laws that deny human services (medical care education) to illegal immigrants or their children?"
"Do you support the enforcement of federal immigration laws by state and local police?"
"Do you support using military tribunals to try suspected terrorists when ordinary civilian courts are deemed inappropriate or impractical?"
"Should law enforcement agencies have greater discretion to monitor domestic communications, to prevent future terrorist attacks?"
"Should the U.S. contribute more funding and troops to United Nations peacekeeping missions?"
"Should the U.S. support the creation of a Palestinian state?"
"Do you support decriminalizing the possession of small amounts of marijuana?"
"Do you support imposing truth in sentencing for violent criminals so they serve full sentences with no chance of parole?"
"Do you support limiting the number of appeals allowed to inmates on death row?"
"Do you support the death penalty in your state?"
"Do you support increasing the minimum wage?"
"Do you support providing direct financial assistance to homeowners facing foreclosure?"
"Do you support reducing government regulations on the private sector in order to encourage investment and economic expansion?"
"Do you support the right of workers to unionize?"
"Do you support a merit pay system for teachers?"
"Do you support abstinence-only sexual education programs?"
"Do you support increasing state funds for hiring additional teachers?"
"Do you support providing parents with vouchers to send their children to any participating school?"
"Is the tenure process for public school teachers producing effective teachers?"
"Do you support allowing doctors to prescribe marijuana to their patients for medicinal purposes?"
"Do you support implementing a universal health care program to guarantee coverage to all Americans regardless of income?"
"Do you support monetary limits on damages that can be collected in malpractice lawsuits?"
"Do you support requiring individuals to purchase health care insurance?"
"Do you support implementing a government-financed single-payer national health care system similar to that of Canada?"
"Do you support making President Bush's tax cuts permanent?"
"Do you support replacing the U.S. income tax structure with a flat income tax?"
"Do you support the permanent repeal of the federal estate tax?"
"Do you support increasing federal taxes on gasoline and diesel fuels to promote conservation and alternative fuel development?"
"Do you support increasing employment and job training programs for welfare recipients?"
"Do you support limiting the benefits given to single women if they have additional children while receiving welfare benefits?"
"Do you support programs that provide job training and placement services for at-risk youth?"
"Do you support providing child care for welfare recipients who work?"
"Do you support redirecting welfare funding to faith-based and community-based private organizations?"
"Do you support cutting taxes, even if it means deep cuts in government programs?"
"Do you support efforts to consolidate 911 services with neighboring areas as a way to save municipal funds?"
